Replies.Reply: Welcome to Who Wants To Be A Millionaire!
Please give a warm welcome to our first contestant of the night- a local from our very own Mumbai!
So, Jamal, tell us a bit about yourself.
A Phone-basher! And what type of call centre would this be?
Aha! So, you're the man who rings me up every single day of my life with Special Offers, huh?
And what does an Assistant Phone-
- a chi-wallah! Why didn't you say?
So, ladies and gentlemen, Jamal Malik from Mumbai, let's play Who Wants To Be A Millionaire...!
Not at all, not at all. I hope you will visit us, Commissioner.
Bring the family. It's a lot of fun.
Inspector. How good to meet you.
So, it is just a question of how, no?
We are lucky to have a man of your obvious experience on the case. This kid might run rings around us filmi types, but he won't make fools out of the Mumbai Police Force, I can see that.
In front of sixty million people.
Which is what will happen if we don't get a result, Gentlemen.
Has he- has he made any allegations?
He's a cunning one. A convincing liar. Don't be taken in, Inspector, don't be taken in.
So, are you ready for your first question for one thousand rupees?
Not bad money to sit in a chair and answer a question. Better than making the tea, no?
No. Yes. No. Apka final answer?
the question:  The lights go down, the portentous music rolls.
Who was the star of the 1973 hit film Zanjeer. Was it A-
What do we think, Jamal? The most famous phrase in our country's history. Maybe you want to phone a friend?
Or Ask the Audience? I have a hunch they might just know the answer. What do we think?
Put the poor man out of his misery, Ladies and Gentlemen.
What do we think, Jamal? A hundred percent would have made me a little more reassured, maybe....
Well, don't despair, there's someone out there who thinks our national motto is "Fashion alone triumphs". You two could be very well matched.
One more question before the commercial break. What will our Call Centre Assistant do next?
Jamal Malik, you answered D? Ram is depicted with a bow and arrow in his hand. And guess what?
Got lucky, huh? I'd take the money. You'll never get the next one.
kitchens, a gym and a screening room. Steel balls is what it takes, my friend, steel balls.
We're having fun here. They love it...Where the hell do you get them from?
Stop wetting your pants. I'll be a good little boy with the next one. Promise.
Meet me after the show. Please.
Baby, it all happened before I met you. I swear to you.
You see? Amidst all this misery, only you can make me laugh.
Her and I- nothing. You have to believe me, baby...
I can't. Without you, it's all pointless.
Calypso Bar, private room, just you and me?
Okay, Juhu boy, you've had a good run. Take your Mother to Khandala and eat some chiki.
Well, your girlfriend then. Even better.
Live wire like you? You surprise me.

Welcome back to Who Wants to be a Millionaire! Our contestant, Jamal Malik, Call Centre Assistant- from Mumbai, is on sixteen thousand rupees and has already used one lifeline: Ask the Audience. So, my friend: are you ready for the next question?
So, what's it to be? Walk away and this cheque for sixteen thousand rupees is yours. Look, it's even got your name on it.
Nope. Looks like the Producer's stolen my wallet again-
Well, well, well. We've got a wild one, here.
For sixty-four thousand rupees, Ladies and Gentlemen, the question once again....
Is the right answer! Sixty-four thousand rupees to you, Sir!
Oh. I see. An expert on the poets, huh?

The question was, for two hundred and fifty thousand rupees: who wrote the famous song Chalo Ri Murali. I should warn you, Jamal: from this question on, if you get the answer wrong you lose everything. So. Are you sure?
So, my friend: ready for another question.

Pay or play, Jamal? All you have to do is stop now and you walk away with a cool quarter of a million rupees. Decide to play, get the answer wrong and you walk away with absolutely nothing. But, get the answer right and you win a million rupees. So. You decide. Pay or play?
Get a lot of hundred dollar bills in your line of work, Jamal?
Now I know why my cell phone bill is so high...they pay the chi-wallah in hundred dollar bills!
Woah! We haven't locked the computer, man. You're going to play?
There's a million rupees at stake and he's never heard of Roosevelt Franklin...I can't bear to look.
No, no. Don't you worry, Jamal.
Jamal Malik- you chose to play not pay. I'm afraid you no longer have two hundred and fifty thousand rupees....
...you in fact have one million rupees!
For two and a half million rupees. Ladies and Gentlemen.
He's smiling. Why does that worry me?
...if you want a chance to be a contestant on Who Wants To Be A Millionaire, dial the number now.
Can someone call me an ambulance?
You can't remember. Does that mean you did know? Once?
Based on your extensive travelling, right?
I thought you hadn't been to UK.
- what might it be then, Jamal?
Cambridge Circus is not in Cambridge? Dare I ask why?
That's the logic that's got him this far, Ladies and Gentlemen.
It's been a rollercoaster ride all the way, a pleasure to have you on the show, my friend, but I'm sorry to say that you're....incredibly, absolutely right!
Ladies and Gentlemen, Jamal Malik, the man with two and a half million rupees!
A few hours ago, you were fetching tea for the phone-
You had two and a half million rupees. If I may-?
Getting hot in here, isn't it?
What? Am I nervous? You're the one who's in the hot seat, my friend.
None. Oh, dear, oh dear, oh dear. Not to worry, there's only ten million rupees at stake...
You've got a cheque for five million rupees in your hands.
Are you sure you want to do this?
The dreams of so many. On the floor.
Time for a commercial break, Ladies and Gentlemen. I know, I know, I can't stand the tension either. Don't even think about leaving your seat. We'll be back.
You've got the luck of the devil, yaar, I'll give you that.
Oh, the toilet. Sure. Naveed, Jamal wants the bog.
A guy from the slums becomes a millionaire overnight. You know the only other person who's done that? Me. I know what it's like.
What? You can't take the money and run now. You're on the edge of history, kid!
Maybe it is written, my friend.
Do the right thing and in approximately three minutes you will be as famous as me.
From rags to Raja. It's your destiny.

Welcome back to Who Wants to Be A Millionaire? In the chair tonight is Jamal Malik- as if we don't know! In an amazing run, Jamal has already five million rupees but, not content with that, has chosen to gamble for one Crore- that's ten million million rupees. What a player!
That's a start. So, it could be Ricky Ponting, Jack Hobbs or Michael Slater.
Okay. Computer, take away two wrong answers.
A hideous, never-ending pause while Jamal stares into Prem's eyes.
So it could be B, Ricky Ponting?
I cannot believe what I am seeing here, tonight, Ladies and Gentlemen....So, are you ready for the final question for two Crore rupees- twenty million rupees?
Maybe, indeed. Okay, okay. For twenty million rupees, the final question on Who Wants to be a Millionaire?

Ohhhhh! Just when I thought I would need a pacemaker fitted, we're out of time! What a show, Ladies and Gentlemen, what a show. Join us tomorrow night to see if Jamal Malik has made the biggest mistake of his life or has just won the biggest prize in the history of Indian television....Same place, same time. You wouldn't dare miss it.
This way, Jamal, this way. Great show, my friend. See you tomorrow, huh?
Oh, come on! Of course he is.
But I am the only man in the world.

Welcome back to Who Wants to be a Millionaire? I can safely say that tonight is the biggest night of both of our lives, Ladies and Gentlemen. Jamal Malik, the Call Centre worker from Mumbai has already won one Crore rupees, a cool ten million. Tonight, he can walk away with that in his pocket or make the biggest gamble in television history and go for the final question and a staggering twenty million rupees! Jamal, are you ready for that question?
Big reader, are you Jamal? A lover of literature?
An involuntary laugh comes out of Jamal's mouth.
The final question, for twenty million rupees: and he's smiling. I guess you know the answer.
You don't? So, you're going to take the ten million and walk?
You just said you don't know the answer. I heard that, right? You do understand that if you get the answer wrong, you lose everything? Ten million rupees.
We're going to the wire, Ladies and Gentlemen, we are going to the wire. The final Life-line.
Doesn't look as if your friend is in, Jamal. Who is it?
- the sort of brother who'd go for a walk on the twenty million rupee question?
Wow! That's cutting it fine. I'm guessing this isn't your brother. This is-
Okay! So, Latika, you want to hear the question one more time?
Ten seconds. So, Latika, what do you think?
You really are on your own, now, Jamal. Your answer: for twenty million rupees.
Ladies and Gentlemen, Jamal Malik, Crorepati! What a night!
I- I get tea for people and-
I have your autograph, oh, holy Amitabh!
You don't have to be a genius.
He's the most famous man in India...!
How much is bhelpuri at Jeevan's stall on Chowpatty Beach?
Wrong. Fifteen since Divali. Who stole Constable Varma's bicycle outside Dadar Station last Thursday?
Not if we let her in.
She could be the third musketeer.
I wake up every morning wishing I didn't know the answer to that question? If it wasn't for Ram and Allah, I would still have a Mother.
You're from the Juhu slum, aren't you?
I don't have a bank account.
Yes. Final answer. Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus.
I wouldn't be here if she had.
The most beautiful woman in the world.
If I knew, I'd tell you.
Four, nine, zero, nine- the one with the stick going down, Salim-
He must be a very good man to look after these people.
...weddings, government things, big parties. If Maman says my voice is ready. Big money.
That's what Arvind said. On Harbour Road. You, me and Salim.
So, this is it, hey, bhai? The good life, here we come....
I've turned professional. What can I do?
Take it! Take it! I can't reach...
Got to go back. We've got to go back.
Blind singers earn double. You know that.
They had other plans. Though it took me a long, long time to find out.
But of course, Madam. Please follow me.

The Taj Mahal was built by the Emperor Khurram for his wife Mumtaz who was maximum beautiful woman in the whole world. When she died, the Emperor decided to build this five star hotel for everyone who wanted to visit her tomb...but he died in- in fifteen eighty-seven, before any of the rooms were built. Or the lifts. The swimming pool, however, as you can see was completed on schedule in top class fashion.
With respect, Madam, the guide book is written by a bunch of lazy, good-for-nothing, Indian beggars.
And this, Lady and Gentleman, is burial place of Mumtaz.
Exactly, Sir. She was on the way to the hospital when it happened.
This is the Princess Diana seat, Madam. Allow me.
Top-class fashion, bottom-class prices! Shoes for all! Shoes for all!
This is the biggest dhobi ghat in the whole of India, Mister David.
They say that every man in Uttar Pradesh is wearing a kurta that has been washed here at least one time.
I don't know! I didn't do it, did I...? Nothing to do with me...get off!
India', Mister David. Here it is.
You can't do that. Can you?
We should have gone a long time ago.
Latika was one of us. A musketeer.
The minimum tip for my services.
I think I just have. Haven't I?
I've never heard of Roosevelt Franklin.
They didn't ask me that question. I don't know why. Ask them.
Two chicken burgers, coke, mango lassi and a bottle of Bisleri.
I'm going to Chowpatti again, okay? Want to come?
We came back to find her.
A building. With a clock on it.
A man- it doesn't say his name.
I don't know. I haven't sung since- since then. Arvind, I-
My eyes? My eyes are fine.
Please. Is she alive? Arvind, is she alive?
Just two minutes to talk to her.
Where did you get the gun?
- shut up, can't you? Just shut up.
We want a room, boy. Executive Class with smoking. Third floor with balcony.
307 here. I want a bottle of Johnny Walker Red Label, beer, wine-
Exactly! A bucket of Pop Tarts, chutiye.
That dance you were doing. In Pila Street. Show me.
No. Salim....Bhai, you've had a lot to drink...
When somebody asks me a question, I tell them the answer.
Oh. Well. She did come back, then she went away when Alfie split up with her and now she's back again.
But it looks as if Alfie still fancies Mo after all, so-
You have to dial when Prem says "if". "If you want the chance to be a contestant on Who Wants To Be A Millionaire..." That's when they open the lines.
That's what Anjum in Technical says. He put the system in.
- just down the road from your house, Mrs Mackintosh. Next to the loch.
Loch Big- Loch Ben. Next door to Detective Taggart's flat.
Indeed yes, Mrs Mackintosh. I have to wade through a metre of water every morning.
Yes, yes, Mrs Mackintosh. In my kilt.
It's alright once I've had my porridge, my haggis and a few Scotch whiskies- and the monsoon's nearly over, so-
I don't think that's a good idea. He is a very important man, Mrs Mackintosh-
- and he doesn't like bloody time wasters.
No. And I've never been to UK before. But I'll still have a go.
Well, Oxford has Broad Street, Saint Aldates, Turl Street, Queen Street, The High and Magdalene Bridge- which is pronounced Maudlin, so-
Oh, I haven't. And it's not Leeds, because that's Elland Road, Kirkgate Market, Commercial Street, St Peter's-
Well, I don't think it's Cambridge.
Too obvious. There's definitely an Oxford Circus in London, and there's a rowing race between Oxford and Cambridge so there's probably a Cambridge Circus too.
If the Gods are with me...Final answer. D.
There was no message at reception.
Javed Mehta? The Gangster from our slum? You work for him?
What do you do for him?
Baba, I am the new cook from the agency. A thousand apologies, I am late for the Memsaab.
Why does everyone love this programme?
You have another life. A rich one.
You don't look so happy with a black eye.
It won't buy you a new dishwasher, but it might make you happy.
You and me. That is the real world. Come away with me.
I'll wait at VT station. Five o'clock every day until you come.
Me, I don't care. Latika? She's already half dead.
I know it isn't Sachin Tendulkar.
Not really, but...maybe it is written, no?
Where are you? Where is she?
Because I am a slum dog, chi-
Would you believe it? I don't.
I'd like to phone a friend.
It's the only number I know.
Silence. The electronic clock ticks loudly.
Truth alone triumphs? I should have known better.
Apart from his name, I can't get a word out of the runt.
Maybe he did know the answers.
The Inspector asked you a question.
A statue of Frederick Stevens, architect and builder of Victoria Terminus in -
Shooting at Pila Street, October 19th...Maman Hossani....Victim pronounced dead at scene.
You've been here all bloody night, Srinivas. What have you been doing?
A little electricity will loosen his tongue.
But you. You've got ten million rupees ek dum guaranteed, yaar?
So. Were you wired up? A mobile or a pager, correct? Some little hidden gadget? No? A coughing accomplice in the audience?
Srinivas! Look, it's hot, my wife is giving me hell, I've got a desk full of murderers, rapists, extortionists, assorted bum-bandits...and you. Why don't you save us both a lot of time?
Amnesty International in here next, peeing their pants about human rights. Get him down, tidy him up, for God's sake.
Indeed, Sir. The proof. That is all we need.
So, Mister Malik, the man who knows the answers. Talk.

So, Jamal. My five-year-old daughter knows the answer to that, but you don't. Strange for a millionaire genius. What happened? Your accomplice nip out for a piss, did he? Or did he just not cough loud enough?
I'll give you five hundred rupees if you just admit it. You go home, I go home. Everybody happy.
No, you want to go back on the programme and win twenty million rupees, don't you?
Now, man to man. How did you know all the answers?
And what happened to the girl?
Who's on the thousand rupee note?
Don't get clever or I'll get the electricity out again.
Funny, you don't seem that interested in money.
Only the finest minds in the Mumbai Police Force.
Not that incredible. You'd just murdered somebody with a Colt 45, after all.
Let's call it manslaughter, then, shall we?
But you: you're not a liar, Mister Malik, that is for sure.
Thank you, Constable. All that remains is to work out whether it was manslaughter or murder.
I- progress is being made sir.
Whilst I'm not convinced he actually cheated, I have got-
That's why he's on the show.
Just one more thing left, Sir.
If you'd like to come with me.
Thought you might need a lift, Sir.
He's unconscious, chutiya. What good is that? How many times have I told you-?
Well, well. The slum dog barks.
- yes, yes, Srinivas. The hundred dollar bill.
How could you drop that? It was a sitter.
Bhai, get out of there. Prakash wants a shit.
Since there was a customer waiting, that's when.
You just lost me good money, you stupid idiot-
- I saw him. He was with them.
She'll have the Security Guard onto us, standing there.
I am the head of this family, now. And I say no. Piss off, you.
We don't even know what the third musketeer's called.
Useless bloody look-out. What good is she, huh?
Okay, let's go, let's go! It's not a bloody holiday!
You'll earn double. I'm doing you a favour, Latika.
He'll kill us if we go back.
She'll be alright. She always is.
Salim puts an arm around Jamal's shoulder. Jamal wipes the tears from his eyes, shakes his head furiously.
One! Pit-stop ka speed, Schumacher ka ishtyle  The crowds in the lane barely notice as the car is stripped of all its parts.
Don't be stupid. We're making good money here.
Oh, God. Baby brother's in love.
For God's sake. You got some disease? You force me back to this shit-hole, we leave our friends, a good life, loads of money- for this. Isn't that enough?
No, you did, Jamal, not me. Me, I don't give a shit about her.
"I'm going to Chowpatti". There are nineteen million people in this city, Jamal. Forget her.
Maman never forgets. Isn't that right?
He was going to kill us.
Bought it. Now, I'm going to have to throw this beauty in the sea.
What? Typical. I save your life and you're on at me. All you ever do is mess us up. Whenever you're around-
Why can't you just be happy, huh?
You got what you wanted, didn't you? So, let's celebrate.
I killed Maman. I'll kill you too. Easy.
I am the elder. And I am the boss. For once, you do as I say.
I saved your bloody life, didn't I?
The man with the Colt 45 says chup.
Now go. Or Gunmaster G-9 will shoot you right between the eyes. Boom. Don't think he won't. You have five seconds.
God is good, bhai. God is good.
Maman's boys were after us. Had to skip.
Can you believe it? This was our slum. We lived just there, huh?
Who else would protect us from Maman's gang, huh?
He is coming. You must go. My card.
You think I am going to let you out of my sight again, little brother? You stay with me now.
Still? She's gone, Jamal. Long gone. Now go. Quick.
Look at it, bhai, look at it!
But younger brothers don't interfere. Mostly.
Why can't you let it alone? You want money, I'll give you money.
Know what your destiny is, crazy boy? A bullet between the eyes.
Yes. About that, you are right.
I didn't sell her. Javed wanted her. He gets what he wants.
She's doing alright. Get it into your thick head, Jamal. She's not yours and she never will be.
Where you'll never find her. Or me. You could have joined us, you bloody idiot, been one of us. You've lost everything now.
We're out. I'll just get- Syed.
That boy. He will never give up.
Salim approaches Latika. She flinches as he walks towards her. He puts some car keys in front of her.
- just drive. There won't be another chance. Go.
You have to. It'll take you two hours if you drive fast. Here.
For God's sake, hold on to it.
For what I have done, please forgive me.
Private-ka land! Private-ka land! The planes won't kill you, mader chod, I will!
I don't know and I don't care.
So, the musketeers return. We are honoured. Salim. Or Porthos, isn't it?
Ram nam satya hai, Babri Masjid dhvasth hai.
Ram has returned to his temple!
It is so kind of you to visit our station, Sir. A great honour.
The Inspector joins them in the corridor.
Nearly? Nearly? When Prem Kumar himself has-
So? Have you charged him yet?
And if that isn't enough for you...
- yes, yes! The boy's a bloody hero with every beggar and thief in the city. We're in danger of looking very stupid, here, Inspector.
- Prem Kumar himself- a man of great standing and integrity-
Get me the Inspector on the phone now!
Stop your time-pass. This is urgent.
Look, kid, I got a bad stomach.
I'm off to Devi's bog. Give me that.
Hot, huh? My name is Maman.
Ja, mada chod. He's not looking for you. Ja!
What the bloody hell is he playing at? He's way off script...
Oh, God, that's all we need....
Okay, he hasn't got a clue. This is going to be a walk-away.
Bloody hell. He's got Prem on the run...
This was you? You called them?
All three, I heard. Nita as well. Back with the wife. She's pregnant again.
Oh, for Sharukh Khan...Stand by white out.
No, he's going to play with him, first.
Hope so. My head is exploding.
Why don't you put it back and listen to the music?
It's called Orfeo. Orpheus and Eurydice. Orpheus- that one there- is looking for his lover, Eurydice. She died, but he can't live without her.
The pain is so bad that he goes to the underworld- the place we go when we die- to try to get her back.
No, kid. Not available. Plenty of others. Take a look.
She's still not on the menu.
No way! You're a bloody Muslim.
Well, if there are seconds, Maman is definitely a Saint.
I tell you, Lord Siva is with us.
Harbour Road! We can have ice cream from Babanji's.
You didn't need to kill him.
Maman's gang will hunt us. You know that?
Haven't I told you, don't interrupt when I'm watching-
- come inside. I'll show you the kitchen.
Jamal smiles hopefully at her. But there is sadness in her now. She takes her sunglasses off, rubs her eyes.
It's the chance to escape, isn't it? Walk into another life.
I have five star food, five star clothes. I sleep in a bed, not on the street. From where we come from, Jamal, that is happiness.
You turn up here out of nowhere, telling me I'm not happy: how dare you?
God, Javed will kill you. Here.
what? What can you provide? What have you got, Jamal?
Love. That will feed us, will it?
Where have you been? Get in the real world, Jamal.
Salim? You still believe in Salim? Jamal...I'll be gone soon, anyway. Bombay's got too dangerous for-
Now go, before he kills us both.
You want to do something for me?
Now, get out and tell your no-
I thought we would meet again only in death.
No need. I read it in bloody Stardust. Didn't even have the balls to tell me. "Prem's happiness with another baby on the way". After everything you said...
She's got the gestation period of an elephant, then.
Not if you were the only man in the world.
You sing like one, and you fight like one. I think you've found your dog, Punnoose.
Very good, very good. I am pleased, Arvind. He is ready.
Okay. Take him out the back.
Now the other one. Salim, go get Jamal.
Gunfighter Number One, isn't that right, Salim? The money, the women, the cars...you want them bad, huh? And why not?
The time has come to choose, yaar. The life of a slum dog or the life of a man. A real man. A gunfighter, Salim.
Your destiny is in your hands, bhai. You can be me. Or nobody.
Jamal, hello. You have done well. It's time for you to- turn professional.
Sing me a song, yaar. How about Chalo Ri Murali, huh? My favourite.
Look who we have here, Punnoose.
You really thought you could just walk in and take my prize away? Have you any idea how much this little virgin is worth, bhen chod?
Take it. Go. Disappear with your friend and we'll forget all about this. Okay?
Oh, Maman can make an exception.
We're not allowed to talk to them.
Namaste, Sahib. Any kindness you give will be repaid in heaven many times.
There are many ways of seeing.
Now you are playing with me, Sahib.
What is on it? The pictures.
The other side. Turn it over.
Benjamin Franklin. My God, my God. Thank you, Sahib. You were generous the first time. But this...
So you are rich, now, are you, Jamal? I am happy for you.
You got away. I didn't. That is all. No, no tears. Tears mock me all the more.
count your blessings every morning you open them and see the sun rising. You owe Maman.
I will sing at your funeral, yaar.
Get back to bed, dogs! What the hell...
Shall I take them to the marshes?

...there are five main elements to the Taj. The Darwaza, the main gateway, the Bageecha or garden, the Masjid or mosque, the Naqqar Khana, the rest house and the Rauza or mausoleum. If you would like to follow me, I will show you the ninety-nine names of Allah on Mumtaz's tomb.
Please, what time is the next tour?
- we're on a very tight schedule, you see, young man.
It says nothing of this in the guide book.
You've seen the way they drive around here...
- so much waiting around in this damned country.
I thought she died in child-
Okay, okay, just cool it. You're insured, aren't you? Jesus Christ...
I give you two tight slaps, mader chod!
Well, here's a bit of the real America, too, son.
Oi, Jamal! There's a woman with no panties on over here.
Smile! Flow, flow! You entice with the hands not make chapattis, you gawaar. Again.
Lift your feet, you lump. Stop, stop!
What the hell do you want?
You silly little boys. Get out now while you can.
My enemy's enemy is my friend, no? So, come in, friend.
First you want a dishwasher, now a bloody cook-
Why do you always watch that shit? Huh? I'm already a millionaire.
Well, come on then, Cook. I'm hungry. Get me a sandwich.
..yeah. He's on eighty-five. I want four lakh on him making a century. What are you giving?...Okay, make it five lakh.
No, no, no! stupid ben chod idiot...
And what is this shit supposed to be, mader chod? Get out. Get out!
What about my bloody whisky, woman?
I never forgot. Not for one day.
Okay, guys, it's been a big week in UK. Kat is back.
- thank you, Jamal. Keep up, Bardi. The chi-wallah knows more than you.
Okay, it's been super-duper hot for UK this week, so there'll be a lot of chat about that- they love their weather- and there's the festival in Edinburgh-
And lochs. Their word for lakes.
Scotland. Kilts, castles, err, haggis? Porridge, the Highlands, mountains. Ben- Ben Nevis?
If they want an upgrade, a new tariff or we're stealing them from the other networks, you take the call. Anything else-
No time-wasters on Team Bradford, kid. Leave that to the homosexuals on Tunbridge Wells.
Where've you been? Dave on Cornmarket's virtually lost his voice, there's two on Ilkley Moor who've had their hands up for hours. Come on, move it!
Two minutes, Jamal. I'm on "Millionaire" duty.
It's my turn, Jamal. I've had my pee breaks. Please. If he comes just keep your head down and pretend you're doing an upgrade on the-
I'd like to be a contestant on Who Wants to be a Millionaire.
